conclusion: Analyze the system before the string breaks
Object A is released from a height of 1 m and moves downward while object B moves up the inclined plane
Gravitational potential energy of object A will be converted to kinetic energy and potential energy of object B
Initial potential energy of object A is 10 J
System is conservative and total mechanical energy is conserved
Initial potential energy of object B is zero and initial velocity of both objects is zero
Calculate the velocity when object A hits the ground
All potential energy of object A is converted into kinetic energy of both objects
Velocities of objects A and B are related by v_A = v_B
Velocity of object B is calculated as 2√5 m/s
Determine the motion of object B after the string breaks
Object B moves up the inclined plane with initial velocity 2√5 m/s and decelerates due to gravity
Component of gravity acting down the inclined plane is calculated as 6 N
Acceleration of object B moving up the inclined plane is -6 m/s²
Calculate the time to return to the bottom of the inclined plane
Time to reach the highest point is calculated as √5/3 seconds
Calculate the distance traveled up the inclined plane
Distance traveled up the inclined plane is calculated as 5/3 m
Calculate the time to return to the bottom
